AssignProject.document: This API is used to specify the project of a TencentDB for MongoDB instance.
AssignProject.name: Specifies the project to which a TencentDB instance belongs

CreateBackupDBInstance.document: This API is used to back up an instance.
CreateBackupDBInstance.name: Creates instance backups

CreateBackupDownloadTask.document: This API is used to create a backup download task.
CreateBackupDownloadTask.name: Creates a backup download task

CreateDBInstance.document: This API is used to create a yearly/monthly subscription TencentDB for MongoDB instance. The [DescribeSpecInfo](https://www.tencentcloud.comom/document/product/240/35767?from_cn_redirect=1) API can be called to query and obtain the supported sales specifications.
CreateDBInstance.name: Creates a monthly subscription TencentDB instance

CreateDBInstanceHour.document: This API is used to create a pay-as-you-go TencentDB for MongoDB instance.
CreateDBInstanceHour.name: Creates a pay-as-you-go TencentDB instance

DescribeAsyncRequestInfo.document: This API is used to query the asynchronous task status.
DescribeAsyncRequestInfo.name: Queries async task status

DescribeBackupDownloadTask.document: This API is used to query information about the backup download task.
DescribeBackupDownloadTask.name: Queries backup download task information

DescribeClientConnections.document: This API is used to query the client connection information on an instance, including the IP address for connection and the number of connections.
DescribeClientConnections.name: Queries client connection information of an instance

DescribeDBBackups.document: This API is used to query the list of instance backups. Currently, only backups created in the last seven days can be queried.
DescribeDBBackups.name: Queries the list of instance backups

DescribeDBInstanceDeal.document: This API is used to get order details of purchase, renewal, and specification adjustment of a MongoDB instance.
DescribeDBInstanceDeal.name: Gets order details of an instance

DescribeDBInstanceNamespace.document: This API is used to query the table information on a database.
DescribeDBInstanceNamespace.name: Queries the databases and tables of an instance

DescribeDBInstances.document: This API is used to query the list of TencentDB for MongoDB instances. It supports filtering primary instances, disaster recovery instances, and read-only instances by project ID, instance ID, instance status, and other conditions.
DescribeDBInstances.name: Queries the list of TencentDB instances

DescribeDetailedSlowLogs.document: This API is used to query slow log details of the instance.
DescribeDetailedSlowLogs.name: Query instance slow log details

DescribeInstanceParams.document: This API is used to query the list of parameters that can be modified for the current instance.
DescribeInstanceParams.name: Queries the modifiable parameter list

DescribeSecurityGroup.document: This API is used to query security groups bound to an instance.
DescribeSecurityGroup.name: Queries the security groups associated with an instance

DescribeSlowLogPatterns.document: This API is used to get the slow log statistics of a database instance.
DescribeSlowLogPatterns.name: Gets slow log statistics

DescribeSlowLogs.document: This API is used to get the slow log information of a TencentDB instance. Only slow logs for the last 7 days can be queried.
DescribeSlowLogs.name: Gets slow log information

DescribeSpecInfo.document: This API is used to query the sales specification of an instance.
DescribeSpecInfo.name: Queries the specifications of purchasable TencentDB instances

FlushInstanceRouterConfig.document: This API is used to run the `FlushRouterConfig` command on all mongos instances.
FlushInstanceRouterConfig.name: Flushes router configuration

InquirePriceCreateDBInstances.document: This API is used to query price of instance creation. The `region` parameter must be passed in this API, otherwise verification will fail. This API allows queries only for purchasable instance specifications.
InquirePriceCreateDBInstances.name: Queries price of instance creation

InquirePriceModifyDBInstanceSpec.document: This API is used to query the price of instance specification adjustment.
InquirePriceModifyDBInstanceSpec.name: Queries price of specification adjustment

InquirePriceRenewDBInstances.document: This API is used to query the renewal price of a monthly subscription instance.
InquirePriceRenewDBInstances.name: Queries the renewal price of an instance

IsolateDBInstance.document: This API is used to isolate a pay-as-you-go TencentDB for MongoDB instance. After isolation, the instance is retained in the recycle bin, and data cannot be written into it. After a certain period of isolation, the instance is deleted permanently. For the retention time in the recycle bin, see the pay-as-you-go service terms. The deleted pay-as-you-go instance cannot be recovered. Proceed with caution.
IsolateDBInstance.name: Isolates a TencentDB Instance

ModifyDBInstanceNetworkAddress.document: This API is used to modify the network information on a TencentDB for MongoDB instance. It supports switching from a basic network to a VPC network or from one VPC network to another VPC network.
ModifyDBInstanceNetworkAddress.name: Modifies the network settings of TencentDB instances

ModifyDBInstanceSecurityGroup.document: This API is used to modify security groups bound to an instance.
ModifyDBInstanceSecurityGroup.name: Modifies the security groups associated with an instance

ModifyDBInstanceSpec.document: This API is used to adjust the TencentDB for MongoDB instance configuration. The [DescribeSpecInfo](https://www.tencentcloud.comom/document/product/240/38567?from_cn_redirect=1) API can be called to query and obtain the supported sales specifications.
ModifyDBInstanceSpec.name: Adjusts the configurations of a TencentDB instance

OfflineIsolatedDBInstance.document: This API is used to deactivate isolated TencentDB instances immediately. The instances must be in isolated status.
OfflineIsolatedDBInstance.name: Deactivates isolated TencentDB instances

RenameInstance.document: This API is used to rename a TencentDB instance.
RenameInstance.name: Renames an instance

RenewDBInstances.document: This API is used to renew a monthly subscription TencentDB instance. Only monthly subscription instances are supported, while pay-as-you-go instances do not need to be renewed.
RenewDBInstances.name: Renews a TencentDB instance

ResetDBInstancePassword.document: This API is used to reset the instance access password.
ResetDBInstancePassword.name: Modifies instance password

SetDBInstanceDeletionProtection.document: This API is used to set instance termination protection.
SetDBInstanceDeletionProtection.name: Sets instance termination protection

TerminateDBInstances.document: This API is used to terminate monthly subscription billing instances.
TerminateDBInstances.name: Monthly subscription return and refund

members.document:
Instance name. Only Chinese characters, letters, digits, underscores (_), and delimiters (-) are supported, with a length of 128 characters. When database instances are purchased in batches, the automatic ascending feature is supported through the custom naming pattern string and numeric suffix to set instance names efficiently.
- Basic mode: prefix + automatic ascending number (starting from 1 by default). Only a custom instance name prefix is required for **lnstanceName**. For example, it can be set to cmgo. If the purchase quantity is set to 5, after purchase, the instances will be sequentially named cmgo1, cmgo2, cmgo3, cmgo4, and cmgo5, respectively.
- Custom starting number mode: prefix + {R:x} (x is the custom starting number). Prefix{R:x} is required for **InstanceName**. For example, cmgo{R:3}. If the purchase quantity is set to 5, the instance names will be sequentially named cmgo3, cmgo4, cmgo5, cmgo6, and cmgo7.
- Composite pattern string: prefix 1{R:x} + prefix 2{R:y}+ ⋯ + fixed suffix, where x and y are the starting numbers of each prefix. A composite pattern string is required for **instanceName**. For example, cmgo{R:10}\_node{R:12}\_db. If the batch purchase quantity is set to 5, the instances will be sequentially named cmgo10\_node12\_db, cmgo11\_node13\_db, cmgo12\_node14\_db, cmgo13\_node15\_db, and cmgo14\_node16\_db.
members.name: InstanceName

members.document:
Specifies the list of AZs during multi-AZ deployment of TencentDB for MongoDB instances.
- For instances in multi-AZ deployment mode, the **Zone** parameter specifies the primary AZ, and **AvailabilityZoneList** specifies all AZs, including the primary AZ. Format: [ap-guangzhou-2,ap-guangzhou-3,ap-guangzhou-4].
- The [DescribeSpecInfo](https://www.tencentcloud.comom/document/product/240/38567?from_cn_redirect=1) API can be called to obtain AZs planned for TencentDB for MongoDB instances in different regions, helping you specify valid AZs.
- Nodes in multi-AZ deployment mode can only be deployed in 3 different AZs. Deploying most nodes of a cluster in the same AZ is not supported. For example, a 3-node cluster does not support deploying 2 nodes in the same AZ.
members.name: AvailabilityZoneList

members.document: Number of Mongos node CPU cores. Valid values: 1, 2, 4, 8, and 16. This parameter is required during sharded cluster instance purchase.
members.name: MongosCpu

members.document:
Instance name. Only Chinese characters, letters, digits, underscores (_), and delimiters (-) are supported, with a length of 128 characters. When database instances are purchased in batches, the automatic ascending feature is supported through the custom naming pattern string and numeric suffix to set instance names efficiently.
- Basic mode: prefix + automatic ascending number (starting from 1 by default). Only a custom instance name prefix is required for **lnstanceName**. For example, it can be set to cmgo. If the purchase quantity is set to 5, after purchase, the instances will be sequentially named cmgo1, cmgo2, cmgo3, cmgo4, and cmgo5, respectively.
- Custom starting number mode: prefix + {R:x} (x is the custom starting number). Prefix{R:x} is required for **InstanceName**. For example, cmgo{R:3}. If the purchase quantity is set to 5, the instance names will be sequentially named cmgo3, cmgo4, cmgo5, cmgo6, and cmgo7.
- Composite pattern string: prefix 1{R:x} + prefix 2{R:y}+ ⋯ + fixed suffix, where x and y are the starting numbers of each prefix. A composite pattern string is required for **instanceName**. For example, cmgo{R:10}\_node{R:12}\_db. If the batch purchase quantity is set to 5, the instances will be sequentially named cmgo10\_node12\_db, cmgo11\_node13\_db, cmgo12\_node14\_db, cmgo13\_node15\_db, and cmgo14\_node16\_db.
members.name: InstanceName

members.document:
Specifies the list of AZs during multi-AZ deployment of TencentDB for MongoDB instances.
 - For instances in multi-AZ deployment mode, the **Zone** parameter specifies the primary AZ, and **AvailabilityZoneList** specifies all AZs, including the primary AZ. Format: [ap-guangzhou-2,ap-guangzhou-3,ap-guangzhou-4].
 - The [DescribeSpecInfo](https://intl.cloud.tencent.com/document/product/240/38567?from_cn_redirect=1) API can be called to obtain AZs planned for TencentDB for MongoDB instances in different regions, helping you specify valid AZs.
 - Nodes in multi-AZ deployment mode can only be deployed in 3 different AZs. Deploying most nodes of a cluster in the same AZ is not supported. For example, a 3-node cluster does not support deploying 2 nodes in the same AZ.

For the currently supported memory specifications, see [Product Specifications](https://www.tencentcloud.comom/document/product/240/64125?from_cn_redirect=1).
**Note**: Memory and disk configurations should be upgraded or downgraded simultaneously, meaning that Memory and Volume should be modified at the same time.
members.name: Memory

members.document:
Hard disk size after instance configuration changes, in GB. If this parameter is left blank, the default value is the current disk size of the instance. For the currently supported disk capacity, see [Product Specifications](https://www.tencentcloud.comom/document/product/240/64125?from_cn_redirect=1).
- Memory and disk configurations should be upgraded or downgraded at the same time, meaning that Memory and Volume should be modified at the same time.
- During configuration downgrade, the disk capacity after changes should be greater than 1.2 times the used disk capacity.
members.name: Volume

 - Unit: GB.
 - By default, the capacity occupied by Oplog is 10% of the disk capacity. The range of capacity occupied by Oplog supported by the system is [10%,90%] of the disk capacity.
members.name: OplogSize

members.document:
Number of Mongod nodes after instance changes (excluding read-only nodes).
- Number of replica set nodes. The value range of the number of nodes can be obtained through the response parameters MinNodeNum and MaxNodeNum of the [DescribeSpecInfo ](https://www.tencentcloud.comom/document/product/240/38567?from_cn_redirect=1) API.
- Number of nodes per shard in a sharded cluster. The value range of the number of nodes can be obtained through the response parameters MinReplicateSetNodeNum and MaxReplicateSetNodeNum of the [DescribeSpecInfo ](https://www.tencentcloud.comom/document/product/240/38567?from_cn_redirect=1) API.
**Note**: When the CPU and memory specifications of Mongod or Mongos nodes are changed, this parameter is not required, or enter the current number of Mongod or Mongos nodes (excluding read-only nodes).
members.name: NodeNum

members.document:
Number of shards after instance changes.
- The value range for the number of instance shards can be obtained through the response parameters **MinReplicateSetNum** and **MaxReplicateSetNum** of the [DescribeSpecInfo](https://www.tencentcloud.comom/document/product/240/38567?from_cn_redirect=1) API.
- The number of instance shards can only be increased and cannot be decreased.
members.name: ReplicateSetNum

SpecItem.document: TencentDB for MongoDB instance sales specification.

members.document:
Specification information identifier. Format: mongo.HIO10G.128G. It consists of three parts: node type, specification type, and memory specification.
- Node type: **mongo** indicates a Mongod node; **mongos** indicates a Mongos node; **cfgstr** indicates a ConfigServer node.
- Specification type: **HIO10G** indicates the general HIO 10GE type; **HCD** indicates the Cloud Disk Edition type.
- Memory specification, in GB. Valid values: 4, 8, 16, 32, 64, 128, 240, and 512. 128g indicates 128 GB.
members.name: SpecCode

members.document:
Saleable specification status flag. Valid values are as follows:
 - 0: selling stopped.
 - 1: available for sale.
